name: Animation

aliases.name: Arc
aliases.type: { x : Float , y : Float , radius : Float , startAngle : Float , endAngle : Float , clockwise : Bool }

aliases.name: CubicCurve
aliases.type: { control1 : ( Float, Float ) , control2 : ( Float, Float ) , point : ( Float, Float ) }

aliases.name: QuadraticCurve
aliases.type: { control : ( Float, Float ), point : ( Float, Float ) }

aliases.name: State
aliases.comment: _Note_ - The compiler will refer to your `Animation.State` as `Animation.Model.Animation msg`

values.name: arc
attr
values.comment: Animate a custom attribute by providing it's name, a float value, and the units it should have.

values.name: attr2
values.type: String -> ( Float, String ) -> ( Float, String ) -> Animation.Model.Property

values.name: attr3
values.type: String -> ( Float, String ) -> ( Float, String ) -> ( Float, String ) -> Animation.Model.Property

values.name: attr4
values.type: String -> ( Float, String ) -> ( Float, String ) -> ( Float, String ) -> ( Float, String ) -> Animation.Model.Property

values.name: attrColor
blur
values.comment: Create a CSS blur filter, these stack with other filters.

values.name: brightness
values.comment: Create a CSS brightness filter, these stack with other filters.

values.name: close
values.comment: Close a Path

values.name: contrast
values.comment: Create a CSS contrast filter, these stack with other filters.

values.name: curve
values.comment:
Create a relative curve with 1 control point and a target point.
This is a Quadratic curve in teh svg spec.

values.name: curve2
values.comment:
Create a relative Curve with 2 control points and a target point.
This is a Cubic Curve in the svg spec.

values.name: curve2To
values.comment:
Create an absolute Curve with 2 control points and a target point.
This is a Cubic Curve in the svg spec.

values.name: curveTo
values.comment:
Create an absolute curve with 1 control point and a target point.
This is a Quadratic curve in teh svg spec.

values.name: custom
values.comment: Animate a custom _style_ property by providing it's name, a float value, and the units it should have.

values.name: custom2
values.type: String -> ( Float, String ) -> ( Float, String ) -> Animation.Model.Property

values.name: customColor
dropShadow
values.comment: Drop shadows will ignore the shadow's `size` value.   This is just one of the bizarre quirks of CSS.

values.name: easing
values.comment:
Specify a custom Easing to animate with.  To be used in conjunction with `StyleWith`, `StyleWithEach`, `toWith`, and `toWithEach`.

The [elm-community/easing-functions](https://github.com/elm-community/easing-functions) package has a bunch of useful easing functions!
values.type: { duration : Time.Time, ease : Float -> Float } -> Animation.Model.Interpolation

values.name: exactly
values.comment:
Set a non-numerical to an exact value.  This is generally only used with `Animation.set`.

For example

```
Animation.set
    [ Animation.exactly "border-style" "dashed"
    ]
```

values.name: filterUrl
values.comment: Create a CSS filter-url

values.name: grayscale
values.comment: Create a CSS grayscale filter, these stack with other filters.

values.name: greyscale
values.comment: Create a CSS grayscale filter, these stack with other filters.  This is a spelling adjusment.

values.name: hueRotate
values.comment: Create a CSS hue-rotation filter, these stack with other filters.

values.name: interrupt
values.comment: Interrupt any running animations with the following animation.
values.type: List (Animation.Model.Step msg) -> Animation.Model.Animation msg -> Animation.Model.Animation msg

values.name: invert
values.comment: Create a CSS invert filter, these stack with other filters.

values.name: loop
values.comment: Repeat a number of steps until interrupted.

values.name: move
offset
values.comment: Used for svg gradients.  Accepts a number between 0 and 1.

values.name: path
values.comment: To be used with the svg path element.  Renders as the d property.

values.name: points
values.comment: Used with the svg polygon element

values.name: queue
values.comment: Add an animation to the queue, execiting once the current animation finishes
values.type: List (Animation.Model.Step msg) -> Animation.Model.Animation msg -> Animation.Model.Animation msg

values.name: render
values.comment:
Render style properties into the style attribute and render other attributes as needed for svg.

Combine "transform" based properties into a single css property.

Combine "filter" based properties into a single css property.

values.name: repeat
values.comment: Repeat a number of steps `n` times.

values.name: saturate
values.comment: Create a CSS saturate filter, these stack with other filters.

values.name: sepia
values.comment: Create a CSS sepia filter, these stack with other filters.

values.name: set
values.comment: Immediately set properties to a value.

values.name: speed
values.comment:
Specify a speed to animate with.  To be used in conjunction with `StyleWith`, `StyleWithEach`, `toWith`, and `toWithEach`.

Generally you don't want this.  It's used in the special case of the default interpolation for rotation.

Use `Animation.spring` or `Animation.easing` instead as they are more powerful.

values.name: spring
values.comment:
Specify a custom Spring to animate with.  To be used in conjunction with `StyleWith`, `StyleWithEach`, `toWith`, and `toWithEach`.

This should be your preferred interpolation to use.

values.name: stopColor
values.comment: Used for svg gradients

values.name: style
values.comment:
Set an initial style for an animation.

Uses standard defaults for interpolation

values.name: styleWith
values.comment: Set an initial style for an animation and override the standard default for interpolation.

values.name: styleWithEach
values.comment:
Set an initial style for an animation and specify the interpolation to be used for each property.

Any property not listed will receive interpolation based on the standard defaults.

values.name: subscription
values.comment:
Create a subscription to AnimationFrame.times.

It is throttled based on whether the current animation is running or not.

values.name: textShadow
values.comment: Text shadows will ignore the shadow's `size` value.   This is just one of the bizarre quirks of CSS.

values.name: to
values.comment: Animate to a set of target values, using the default interpolation.

values.name: toWith
values.comment:
Animate to a set of target values. Use a temporary interpolation instead of the default.
The interpolation will revert back to default after this step.

values.name: toWithEach
values.comment:
Animate to a set of target values. Use a temporary interpolation for each property instead of the default.
The interpolation will revert back to default after this step.

values.name: update
values.comment: Update an animation.

name: Animation.Messenger
comment:
Import this module if you want the ability to send a Msg at any point during your animation.

@docs State, update, send, Step

aliases.name: State
aliases.comment: An Animation State that also tracks your `Msg` type.

values.name: send
values.comment:
An animation `Step` which will send a message.  For example

    Animation.interrupt
        [ Animation.to [Animation.opacity 0]
        , Animation.send OpacityIsNotZero
        ]

values.name: update
values.comment: An update that returns the updated animation as well as any messages sent in `Cmd` form.
values.type: Animation.Model.Tick -> Animation.Model.Animation msg -> ( Animation.Model.Animation msg, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

name: Animation.Spring.Presets
comment:
Spring presets to be used with `Animation.styleWith` and `Animation.toWith`

@docs Spring, zippy, wobbly, stiff

values.name: stiff
wobbly
zippy
values.comment: The default used by elm-style-animation.
